Class Player

java.lang.Object
Player
public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
Provides data fields and methods to create a Java data-type, representing a player in a tic tac toe game program.
Since:
July 15, 2021

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Player​(java.lang.String n, char m)
    Contructs a new Player object by assigning name and mark to the given String and char values.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    java.lang.String findName​(char mark)
    Finds the name of the player associated with the given mark.
    void makeMove()
    Asks the current player to enter the coordinates in which they want to place their mark.
    void play()
    Allows current player to make a move, displays the board, then passes the turn to the other player until there is a winner or the game ends in a tie.
    void setBoard​(Board theBoard)
    Sets the board.
    void setOpponent​(Player p)
    Sets the opponent of the player.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player​(java.lang.String n, char m)
      Contructs a new Player object by assigning name and mark to the given String and char values.
      Parameters:
      n - name of Player
      m - mark of Player

  • Method Details

    • play

      public void play()
      Allows current player to make a move, displays the board, then passes the turn to the other player until there is a winner or the game ends in a tie. Prints out a message at the end of the game, indicating the winner or that the game ended in a tie.

    • findName

      public java.lang.String findName​(char mark)
      Finds the name of the player associated with the given mark.
      Parameters:
      mark - mark of player
      Returns:
      name of the player associated with the mark

    • makeMove

      public void makeMove()
      Asks the current player to enter the coordinates in which they want to place their mark. If the space is empty, a mark will be placed. If the space is already marked, the player will be prompted to try again until they enter coordinates for a valid space on the board.

    • setOpponent

      public void setOpponent​(Player p)
      Sets the opponent of the player.
      Parameters:
      p - opponent

    • setBoard

      public void setBoard​(Board theBoard)
      Sets the board.
      Parameters:
      theBoard - the tic tac toe board
